direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods interact with element attributes but perform different operations (retrieval vs. existence check).
Both methods deal with attribute retrieval but 'eachAttr' collects all attributes while 'attr' retrieves the first one.
Both methods handle attribute operations, but 'attr(String, String)' sets an attribute value while 'attr(String)' retrieves it.
Both methods interact with element attributes, but 'removeAttr' removes the attribute while 'attr' retrieves or sets it.
Both methods modify element attributes, but 'addClass' modifies the class attribute while 'attr' handles general attributes.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing elements with a collection is similar to setting up elements for attribute operations.
Selecting elements based on a query is a prerequisite for performing attribute operations on them.
Verifying attributes post-operation can help in asserting the correctness of the 'attr' method.
